page.title: 08FARMING AROUND TURNERS HILL
page.content: Most of the farms around Turners Hill are{dairy farms.}Mainly the herds are {British Friesian.}One farmer also runs {sheep}called fatteners on his land in the Spring. Some of these farmers grow some{feedstuffs}as well as having {maintained grassland for grazing.}Two farms,{Tulley's}and{Worth Hall,}both owned by Mr Beare are completely different. They are{pick-your-own farms. The public are able to pick {fresh produce in season.}These farms are very popular and people come from miles around so that they can have really{fresh vegetables}and{fruit. They can also pick enough to fill their freezers. There is a{playground for children and a{picnic area}so that families can enjoy a day out. Mr Beare is able to employ a lot of people on a part time basis as well as still employ his regular workers.
